intro: Habracanthus heliophilus, commonly known as the sun-loving habracanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in full sunlight and well-drained soils, making it a hardy species in arid environments. Its unique floral structure attracts pollinators such as bees and birds, contributing to its ecological significance.
